intro: Rosa caryophyllacea f. ruszkinensis, commonly known as the Ruszkin's rose, is a rare and distinctive cultivar of the Rosa caryophyllacea species. It is characterized by its pale pink to white flowers, which are often more delicate and less fragrant compared to typical roses. The plant typically grows as a shrub with thorny stems and dark green, leathery leaves. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it suitable for garden cultivation in temperate climates. Due to its rarity and unique appearance, it is highly valued by botanists and horticulturists alike.
